roleset.name: to come into conflict, be in opposition

role.descr: 1st, all in one mention, or agentive clasher
entity clashed with when separat constituent

example.name: transitive
example.text: A successor was n't named [*-1] , which [*T*-35] fueled speculation that Mr. Bernstein may have clashed with S.I. Newhouse Jr. , whose family company , Advance Publications Inc. , [*T*-2] owns Random House .
example.arg: with S.I. Newhouse Jr. , whose family company , Advance Publications Inc. , [*T*-2] owns Random House

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Mr. Azoff reportedly was bored and frequently clashed with top MCA management over a number of issues such as compensation and business plans .
example.arg: over a number of issues such as compensation and business plans

role.descr: agent, one causing a clashing noise
location, thing that the theme clashes against

example.name: Theme as subject
example.text: As the drum set fell over, the cymbals clashed against the floor.
example.arg: As the drum set fell over

example.name: With agent as subject, from google
example.text: He has clashed the cymbals and banged the drums.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'clash' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

frameset.note: frames created by Olga, revised by Kevin
